metadata.dc:author: Aznar Rodríguez, Silvia
Martínez Fuster, Sandra
Boix Carreño, Eva
Moreno Pérez, Oscar
Picó Alfonso, Antonio M
Revert Marrahí, Paula
metadata.dc:description: Clinically silent corticotroph adenomas are rare. The clinical course of these tumors varies: while some have an insidious course, others behave aggressively, especially during tumoral recurrence. Given the absence of clinical and biochemical features of hypercortisolism, the definitive diagnosis is histological.
metadata.dc:title: Silent corticotroph adenomas of the pituitary gland: apropos of two cases.
metadata.dc:publisher: Endocrinologia y nutricion : organo de la Sociedad Espanola de Endocrinologia y Nutricion
